1) Introduction

My thanks to Olexandr Prohorov, Holger Lieske, Mikhail Golubev, Istvan Brindza, Bjorn Ivar Karlsson, Jonathan Carlstedt, Matthew Sadler, Pedro Alberdi, Ian Lamb, Herman Van Riemsdijk, DR Thomas, Alex Holowczak, Dennis Monokroussos, Henri Koskinen, Thomas Johansson, Rudy van Kemenade, Andreas Langousis, Grant Oen and everyone else who helped with this issue.

The Russian Team Championships seen some very strong match ups and even an interesting performance from the now largely retired Anatoly Karpov against Peter Svidler. Wei Yi won the Chinese Championships winning all his games with white and going undefeated. I can't help feeling he needs less chess of a higher quality now. Lots of Junior chess about which no doubt is deciding qualifiers for the World Junior Championships in Tarvisio, Italy at the start of October. Also National Championships such as the Czech won by David Navara with 7.5/9 in spite a of a defeat along the way. Plenty of good standard chess to look at. This week the return of the Sigeman & Co Chess Tournament is to be welcomed and the second FIDE Grand Prix tournament, this time in Moscow follows a day later.

Hope you enjoy this issue.

Mark
